sect1.title: Record Set Record Set Operators Record Set Operators
sect1.para: The following record set operators are supported (all require that the files were created using identical RECORD structures RECORD structure ):

row.entry: Append all records from both files, independent of any order
Append all records from both files, maintaining record order on each node

sect2.title: Prefix Append Operator

row.entry: A comma-delimited list of record sets to append (two or more). All the record sets must have identical RECORD structures.
Optional. A comma-delimited list of options from the list below.

sect2.para: The prefix append operator (+) provides more flexibility than the simple infix operators described above. It allows hints and other options to be associated with the operator. Similar syntax will be added in a future change for other infix operators.
The following options may be used:

row.entry: Optional. Specifies the output record order is not significant.
Specifies the significance of the output record order.
When False, specifies the output record order is not significant. When True, specifies the default output record order.
Optional. Specifies the input record order is significant.
Optional. Specifies the input record order is not significant.
Optional. Try to evaluate this activity in parallel.
Optional. Try to evaluate this activity using numthreads threads.
Optional. Override the algorithm used for this activity.
The algorithm to use for this activity. Must be from the list of supported algorithms for the SORT function's STABLE and UNSTABLE options.
